Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2009 07:35PM mommyluvsnoah wrote: mahalahondre They found microcalcifications on my mammogram in December. I had a needle biopsy done first to see if they were cancerous, which they were.  The needle biopsy was not bad at all and if you are nervous you can ask your Dr. to prescribe you valium before the procedure.  It helped calm my nerves and relax me.  My results came back DCIS, non-invasive, stage 0.  After the biopsy results the next step for me would have been an MRI to see if there was anything else present. However I knew I would want a bilateral Mx so that step was unecessary in my case.  The Dr. recommended treatment was lumpectomy and radiation.  If I were you I would do a biopsy so you know what you are dealing with quickly and can then start making decisions.

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2008 03:58PM mommyluvsnoah wrote: Thanks for all the kind words and encouragement.  I had a consultation with the breast surgeon today and feel a little better.  He did an exam and didn't find any other areas of concern. We talked about the different scenarios depending upon the biopsy and I made it clear that if it was cancer I wanted a double masectomy so we talked about that a little.  Ideally I would like to have reconstruction right away but since there is a concern about the rate of change with my mammogram that may not be the best option since it would involve finding a plastic surgeon and coordinating schedules.  I am taking my Mom with me to the biopsy tomorrow and the gave me a prescription for valium plus said I could take a Darvecet for pain.  The one good thing about being told by several people that it is most likely cancer is that I won't be waiting on pins and needles for the results. Instead I will be making some decisions this weekend so when the results come in we can get moving.  And of course if by some miracle they are all wrong and it is beneign then I will feel incredibly blessed. I do know though that if it is beneign I am going to insist on an MRI on both breast to double check everything. I am actually relieved that we will be getting definite answers soon and moving forward.
